externals.name: CWE-335: Incorrect Usage of Seeds in Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG)
externals.description: The product uses a Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG) but does not correctly manage seeds.

externals.name: CWE-369: Divide By Zero
externals.description: The product divides a value by zero.

externals.name: CWE-480: Use of Incorrect Operator
externals.description: The product accidentally uses the wrong operator, which changes the logic in security-relevant ways.

externals.name: CWE-681: Incorrect Conversion between Numeric Types
externals.description: The product accidentally uses the wrong operator, which changes the logic in security-relevant ways.

externals.name: XML Injection
externals.description: An attacker utilizes crafted XML user-controllable input to probe, attack, and inject data into the XML database, using techniques similar to SQL injection. The user-controllable input can allow for unauthorized viewing of data, bypassing authentication or the front-end application for direct XML database access, and possibly altering database information.
